name: Public
slogan: Helping startups transform the public sector
description:
Public is here to help technology startups transform public services, providing capital, networks, insight and support. The global govtech market is worth £320bn, but startups struggle to access it. 

Led by ex-deputy head of the No.10 policy unit, Daniel Korski, and venture investor, Alexander de Carvalho, Public’s team has operational experience of government, startups, technology and finance, to help startups do business successfully with the public sector.

In March 2017, we launched applications to GovStart, a growth programme based in London to get startups ready for the public sector, and help them through the sales cycle.

The Public team will build an individual programme for every startup joining GovStart depending on their product, market, knowledge gaps and time commitment. 

 Visit our website (public.io) to find out more.

team.name: Alexander de Carvalho
team.bioHtml: CIO at Public. Public exists to help technology startups transform public services, providing capital, networks, insight and support.

team.name: Daniel Korski
team.bioHtml: Ex No 10 aide, entrepreneur, CEO of Public, a venture aimed at helping technology startups transform public services

team.name: Mark Lazar
team.bioHtml: Head of Platform @Public Previously @Techstars : Barclays Techstars London: x2 Techstars London: x2 Barclays Techstars Tel Aviv: x1

jobs.title: Head of Events
jobs.description:
Are you an experienced events professional who is adept at both Sales and Production?

Are you looking for more strategic control of your events portfolio?

PUBLIC has established Europe’s biggest GovTech conference, the GovTech Summit, in Paris. We are now looking for an ambitious and experienced events professional to build on this success by developing and executing on a future events strategy in Europe. You will have the support of a sponsorship sales manager and an operations associate, as well as the possibility of growing your team as opportunities arise.

PUBLIC is looking for a strategic events professional with a commercial events background to join its growing team in London. The Head of Events is a pivotal role within the business that combines excellent people management and motivational skills with a strong entrepreneurial ethos. 

Core responsibilities include:

Strategy Development & Execution

Build the PUBLIC events brand, starting with the GovTech Summit but building out to other events under that brand family, both in Europe and Internationally.

Develop an annual strategic plan and objectives for the overall department and each event

Develop a financial forecast taking accountability for overall strategic and financial growth

Identify event launch and growth opportunities to strengthen the portfolio year on year; leveraging our research topics and conducting in-depth market research to determine the commercial viability and go-to-market strategy of future events

P&L & Budget Responsibility

Monitor and increase net profitability, continually reviewing and adjusting revenue and cost targets.

Overseeing each event to balance risk, maximize lead time and optimize profits.

Direct Oversight of Events Team

Hire, develop and retain an “A” grade team

Ultimately our Head of Events will be tasked with the ongoing growth of a portfolio of events and a team of talented professionals. They will be a strategic thinker with passion and energy to roll up their sleeves and get things done. A team player who loves to drive performance, develop talent achieve exceptional results. If this sounds like you we would love to talk to you!

REQUIREMENTS
Our Ideal Candidate:

A passionate person who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is motivated by our company mission and keen to become expert in the GovTech space.

A team player who is genuinely collaborative and willing to get their hands dirty when it’s needed

Excellent verbal and written communication skills 

Commercial and profit focused, an agile thinker who assimilates complex information quickly.

A multi-tasker with exceptional organizational skills and the ability to juggle projects and drive results

Experience

Proven track record in commercial B2B conference/events management (Conference, 1-2-1 Meetings, Exhibition/Confex. Publishing, Business Intelligence) with experience in both conference sales and program development

People management experience

Experience in the following industry sectors is an advantage but not a requirement: public services or technology

Language skills advantageous, particularly French, German and/or Danish.

BENEFITS
Our own co-working space, PUBLIC Hall, located in the heart of Whitehall

Competitive compensation package (base salary + equity + pension contribution)

25 days holiday, increasing by 1 with each year of service to a maximum of 30

Additional days off between Christmas and New Year and for bank holidays.

Dedicated learning and development days

Personal wellness budget

ABOUT US

PUBLIC helps technology startups transform public services. We provide insight, support, networks and capital to entrepreneurs with the latest and most innovative ideas; helping them improve the lives of citizens through enhancing the services that the government provides.

Led by ex-deputy head of the No.10 policy unit, Daniel Korski, and venture investor, Alexander de Carvalho, PUBLIC’s team has operational experience across government, startups, technology and finance.

Find out more about PUBLIC at www.public.io

Please apply via this link: https://app.beapplied.com/apply/ze197xfdl4

jobs.title: Sponsorship Manager
jobs.description:
Be part of an exciting and expanding event production team in PUBLIC’s London office as a Sponsorship Sales Manager. This position is ideal for an experienced candidate looking to break into the events arena.

The Sponsorship Sales Manager will help us deliver revenue on our events and research programme, including high profile conferences like the Govtech Summit in Paris. They will work closely with the Head of Events, the Head of Growth and the Head of Research to identify, secure and manage sponsorship, primarily for our events programme, as well as our broader product portfolio, including research, as required.

The Sponsorship Sales Manager will;

Ensure maximum possible delivery against sales targets through the generation of new business as well as the retention of existing customers;

Develop and manage a strong pipeline of new sponsorship opportunities;

Work closely with other departments such as Communications and Event Operations to deliver exceptional customer experience to both new and existing sponsors;

Develop relationships with sponsors by understanding their needs and formulating innovative and creative sponsorship opportunities

Build an extensive understanding of market trends and developments in GovTech, as well as our product and the competitor landscape;

Attend our events in the UK, and Europe to work closely with sponsors to deliver world class on-site experiences;

Liaise with sponsors and provide feedback to development teams to help optimise our product offering and overall event strategy

REQUIREMENTS
Who are we looking for?

Highly ambitious individuals who are keen to make a positive impact on their sales skills development and earning potential

Experience within a business-to-business (B2B) sales environment

A strong communicator with the ability to engage confidently with senior stakeholders

Business acumen and a strong commercial awareness

The Ideal candidate:

Confident communicator

Pro-active learner

Detail oriented

Multi-tasker

Team player

Language skills a plus, particularly French, German or Danish

BENEFITS

c.£25,000 plus 3% pension contribution + competitive commission scheme

25 days holiday per year, rising one day per year up to a maximum of 30.

Additional days off between Christmas and New Year, and for bank holidays.

Personal wellness budget

Dedicated Learning & Development days


Please apply via this link: https://app.beapplied.com/apply/w6diiflnac
